name: Awakened Zurkhwood
subtitle: Huge plant, unaligned
languages: one language known by its creator

special_abilities.name: False Appearance
special_abilities.desc: While the tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal zurkhwood mushroom.

special_abilities.name: Mute
special_abilities.desc: If the awakened zurkhwood was created by a myconid sovereign, it can't speak.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.
actions.name: Slam

special_abilities.name: Fungus Stride
special_abilities.desc: Once on its turn, the bridesmaid can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living mushroom or fungus patch within 5 feet and emerge from another within 60 feet of the first one, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second mushroom or fungus patch. The mushrooms and patches must be large or bigger.

actions.description: The bridesmaid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
actions.name: Hallucination Spores

actions.description: The bridesmaid releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).
actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: Buppido has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, Buppido has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, Buppido can choose to deal no damage and knock it prone.
actions.name: Hooked Spear

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.
actions.name: Light Crossbow

special_abilities.name: Mushroom Portal
special_abilities.desc: The chamberlain counts as a mushroom for the Fungus Stride feature of the bridesmaid of Zuggtmoy.

special_abilities.name: Poison Spores
special_abilities.desc: Whenever the chamberlain takes damage, it releases a cloud of spores. Creatures within 5 feet of the chamberlain when this happens must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.description: The chamberlain makes two slam attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.
actions.name: Slam

actions.description: The chamberlain releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).
actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)

actions.description: The spore servant makes two pincer attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (Escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the spore servant doesn't have two other creatures grappled.
actions.name: Pincer

special_abilities.name: Duergar Resilience
special_abilities.desc: Horgar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, Horgar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

special_abilities.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
special_abilities.desc: Horgar wields Gauntlets of Ogre Power giving him a Strength score of 19 (+4).

special_abilities.name: Brave
special_abilities.desc: Horgar has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

actions.description: For 1 minute, Horgar magically increases in size, along with anything he is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, Horgar is Large, doubles his damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If Horgar lacks the room to become Large, he attains the maximum size possible in the space available.
actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

actions.description: Horgar magically turns invisible until he attacks, casts a spell, or uses his Enlarge, or until his concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Horgar wears or carries is invisible with him.
actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

actions.description: Horgar makes two melee attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 11 (1d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands. While Horgar is enlarged, the damage increases to 15 (2d8 + 6) or 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, respectively.
actions.name: +2 Warhammer

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.
actions.name: Heavy Crossbow

actions.description: For 1 minute, Horgar can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that he can see within 30 ft. of Horgar makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand Horgar. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if Horgar is incapacitated.
actions.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: Horgar adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Horgar must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

special_abilities.name: Special Equipment
special_abilities.desc: Droki wears boots of speed.

special_abilities.name: Insanity
special_abilities.desc: Droki has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

special_abilities.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
special_abilities.desc: Droki deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Droki that isn't incapacitated and Droki doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.desc: Droki's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

actions.description: Droki makes two attacks with his shortsword
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. The sword is coated with serpent venom that wears off after the first hit. A target subjected to the venom must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
actions.name: Shortsword

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: Droki adds 3 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Droki must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.
actions.name: Shortsword

special_abilities.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Javelin

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
special_abilities.desc: Eldeth has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.description: Eldeth makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.
actions.name: Shortsword

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.
actions.name: Longbow

actions.description: The scout makes two melee attacks.

special_abilities.name: Spider Climb
special_abilities.desc: The lizard can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.
actions.name: Bite

special_abilities.name: Camouflage
special_abilities.desc: The octopus has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

special_abilities.name: Water Breathing
special_abilities.desc: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the octopus can't use its tentacles on another target.
actions.name: Tentacles

actions.description: A 20-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the octopus can use the Dash action as a bonus action.
actions.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

spellcasting.desc: Grisha is a 6th-level-spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:

actions.description: Grisha makes two attacks with his +1 flail.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage
actions.name: +1 Flail

actions.description: The spore servant makes two hook attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.
actions.name: Hook

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.
actions.name: Bite

reactions.name: Barbed Tail
reactions.desc:
When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the ixitxachitl, the ixitxachitl can make the following attack instead of using its bite.
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

spellcasting.desc: The ixitxachitl is a 5th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The ixitxachitl has the following cleric spells prepared:

actions.name: Bite

special_abilities.name: Dwarven Resilience
special_abilities.desc: The guard has advantage on saving throws against poison.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage.
actions.name: Halberd

special_abilities.name: Cunning Action
special_abilities.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

special_abilities.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
special_abilities.desc: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.description: The spy makes two melee attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Shortsword

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

special_abilities.name: Insanity
special_abilities.desc: Narrak has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: Narrak has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, Narrak has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

spellcasting.desc: Narrak is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (Save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks) Narrak has two 2nd-level spell slots, which he regains after finishing a short or long rest, and knows the following warlock spells:

actions.description: Narrak casts mage armor on himself
actions.name: Armor of Shadows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.
actions.name: Shortsword

actions.description: While he is in a dim light or darkness, Narrak can become invisible. He remains so until he moves or takes an action or reaction.
actions.name: One with Shadows

special_abilities.name: Wounded Fury
special_abilities.desc: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, Prince Derendil has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

actions.description: Prince Derendil makes two claw attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.
actions.name: Claw

special_abilities.name: Two Heads
special_abilities.desc: Because of its two heads, the Spider King has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

special_abilities.name: Spider Climb
special_abilities.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

special_abilities.name: Web Sense
special_abilities.desc: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

special_abilities.name: Web Walker
special_abilities.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.
actions.name: Bite

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).
actions.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)

special_abilities.name: Stone Camouflage
special_abilities.desc: The Pudding King has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

special_abilities.name: Gnome Cunning
special_abilities.desc: The Pudding King has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

special_abilities.name: Insanity
special_abilities.desc: The Pudding King has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

spellcasting.desc: The Pudding King's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
The Pudding King is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The Pudding King knows the following sorcerer spells:

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.
actions.name: War Pick

actions.description: The Pudding King magically transforms into an ooze, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. In ooze form, the Pudding King retains his alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form.
actions.name: Change Shape

actions.description: The Pudding King creates a patch of green slime (see "Dungeon Hazards" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). The slime appears on a section of wall, ceiling, or floor within 30 feet of the Pudding King.
actions.name: Create Green Slime (Recharges after a Long Rest)

special_abilities.name: Chameleon Skin
special_abilities.desc: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

special_abilities.name: Stench
special_abilities.desc: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

special_abilities.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
special_abilities.desc: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.description: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with either its claws or its greatclub.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.
actions.name: Bite

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.
actions.name: Claw

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.
actions.name: Greatclub

actions.description: The troglodyte spits acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
actions.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the ixitxachitl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.
actions.name: Vampiric Bite

reactions.name: Barbed Tail
reactions.desc:
When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the ixitxachitl, the ixitxachitl can make the following attack instead of using its bite.

actions.description: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.
actions.name: Multiattack

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
special_abilities.desc: If Yestabrod fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (3d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage.
actions.name: Slam

actions.description: Yestabrod releases spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage at the start of each of Yestabrod's turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.
actions.name: Caustic Spores (1/Day)

actions.description: Yestabrod releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).
actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)

special_abilities.name: Pack Tactics
special_abilities.desc: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.description: The thug makes two melee attacks
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Mace
